title: Forum for Equality's Acclaim Awards honors Rabbi Alexis Berk, Judge Paula Brown, Breakout! and Douglas Hallward-Driemeir
text:
For attendees of Forum for Equality's 17th annual Acclaim Awards on Saturday (Sept. 26), it seemed like the unofficial theme was love.
"I profess to the religion of love," said Touro Synagogue Rabbi Alexis Berk, quoting Rumi, a 13th-century scholar and mystic, while accepting her Faith and Equality Award. Matrimonial love was personified by Michael Louis Robinson and Earl Benjamin , the first same-sex couple to wed in Louisiana, who introduced the Leadership Award to Judge Paula Brown, who officiated their ceremony. Other honorees included: Political Activism Award: BreakOUT!, for its work with LGBTQ youth in New Orleans; and the Legal Award: Douglas Hallward-Driemeir, an attorney who successfully argued along with Mary Bonauto on behalf of the marriage plaintiffs in the United States Supreme Court in Obergefell v. Hodges.
When emcee Bob Mann wasn't at the podium, event co-chairs Matt Davis and Sean Sullivan (also the Forum's foundation board chairman), Forum board Chairman Chris Otten, Forum PAC Chairman Justin Woods , Forum Executive Director SarahJane Brady, and board member Mary Griggs were there either introducing honorees or praising those who have helped the organization. Before and after the ceremonies there was music by Davis Rogan and Alexis and the Samurai , as well as a silent auction.
Seen in the audience in the Westin Canal Place Hotel were Joey Walker and John Malta, Chris Fransen and Sam Mercer, Tracy Moore, Jack Sullivan, Bently Graham, Jared Frank, Matt Madden, Catherine Coyle, Ashley Byrne, Blainey Kern, Gunnar Guidry, Dr. Ivan Sherman, Dr. Jody Gates, Deon Haywood, Raul Vasquez, Michael Mantese, Evan Stout, Augie Gallo, Lourdes Moran, Cantor David Mintz and Deborah Sacks Mintz, Mark Ledet, Dr. John Estrada, Evone Zander, Paul Kellogg, Emily Beasley, Renee Lapeyrolerie, Marilyn McConnell, Danielle Levine, Hon. Marie Bookman, and Vanessa Levine, and a number of current Orleans Parish judges, in addition to Brown, including Rose Ledet, Regina Woods, Angelique Reed, Tiffany Chase, Bernadette D'Souza, Nakisha Ervin-Knott, Veronica Henry, and Joseph Landry .
The event was also a benefit for the organization, a LGBT human rights organization that advocates for full equality.
